reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights (first time in Tokyo). It is perfectly located as you have very good access to the subway within 5 minutes walking distance. (there are 3 lines crossing here at the "Aoyama 1-chome"-station: Ginza-line/Hanzomon-line/Oedo-line. That makes it very easy to get arround in Tokyo from here in short distances: 5-10 minutes train-ride to Shinjuku, Shibuya or Ginza)- 15minutes walk to night-life area Roppongi
reviews.title: best low-budget deal in Tokyo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are very small, which did not bother us as we did not stay much in our hotel - only for sleeping.
reviews.title: ACOJ Fully Meets Expectations

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, good accommodation, very helpful staff.
likes.disliked: — Corridors smell of smoke but bearable - this is Japan and you need to accept that in Japan smoking in public places has not been outlawed in the same way as the UK /USA.

reviews.title: Clean, great price, good location
reviews.text: Very quit and safe area with mostly residential buildings and some embassies in the neighborhood.

The reception staff are very friendly and speak a very good English. E.g. they helped us in booking a tea ceremony at the "Sado Kaikan" (They made the full fax correspondence and even made a translated print-out of the location map.)
reviews.title: Great Little Find

likes.disliked: — A little difficult to get to from the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room rates are at an unbeatable low price of only arround 70 EURO per night - a real bargain for a 3*-hotel in Tokyo! The money saved we rather spent with good japanese food :-)
reviews.title: Good choice in Tokyo

reviews.text: First hotel we stayed at in Tokyo (note: after living in Kanazawa for 6 weeks). The subway station is easily accessible, but doesn't have escalators near the exits close to the hotel- which made dragging all our luggage around a bit of a chore at some points.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The hotel is easy to find once you've found it before but when you're heading there for the first time- definitely have the directions handy. It's a walk from the station, but not bad. People in the area are very likely to be helpful if you approach them, or are likely to approach you and ask if you need help if you look lost enough (as was the case with us). As you'll see when you get there, the area is a big business area, although there's a cafe or two and a few convenience stores close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Asia

reviews.text: The staff speaks english well, and the room, while small, was big enough (we had 3 people, 2 double beds). Internet access was free and worked. We also had a small refrigerator and hot water pot.
reviews.title: Clean and Tidy, with OK location
Excellent for budget travelers
reviews.text: Overall, the experience lived up the apparent reputation of a decent place for the money- decent location and a pretty good rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Hotel Asia for 5 nights.
reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Asia Center of Japan for 3 nights in a twin room. The twin room is a decent size for Japanese hotels. The bathroom however was cramped but had a high tech toilet with bidet function. Free internet is also available in the rooms. The hotel is located 5 mins from the subway and 15 mins from Roppongi which is a tourist hotspot. The rooms and hotel were very clean, staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful with restaurant suggestions. Breakfast is not included but there was free bottled water available in the lobby. There are many nearby restaurants to choose from as well as banks and 24hr convenience stores. The area is very safe and quiet at night. I will definitely stay here when I visit Tokyo again.
reviews.title: Great value, excellent area to stay in

likes.liked: — Great value, good location, good service

reviews.text: The staff were great and most helpful. The front desk folks were good at speaking English though my wife is Japanese and that certainly helped. The place is clean and the halls only had a slight smell of smoke which didn't bother either of us. We found the breakfast most convient and reasonable considering we were in a pricey area of Tokyo.
reviews.title: Reasonable rates and fantastic location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area is great and the subway most convenient. One item to note is that many subways do not have escalators or elevators so travelers that tend to pack heavy, like us, will lug big suitcases up a lot of steps if arriving/departing from the hotel by the subway as we do. My suggestion is to resist the urge to pack heavy and take advantage of the washers and dryers at the hotel. Your back will thank you for a lighter suitcase!
reviews.title: Thank you for a great stay Tripadvisors!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much else to say except this is now our hotel of choice in Tokyo. We aren't budget travellers per se but do recognize a good deal and this is one of them. Since all we do is basically sleep in the hotel the money we save is better spent on excellent sushi/sashimi, sake and shopping.
reviews.title: Fantasic budget hotel, Great location

likes.disliked: — Avoid the restaurant it is overpriced and there are great restaurants nearby
